title: The Pink Hotel by Anna Stothard
description:
LONGLISTED FOR THE ORANGE PRIZE / NEW YORK TIMES BOOK REVIEW EDITORS' CHOICE

Ã¢â‚¬Å“This book moved and provoked me in ways I canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t fully articulate....Extraordinary.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½Ã¢â‚¬â€Anna Paquin (True Blood)

A seventeen-year-old girl pieces together the mystery of her motherÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s life and death among the bars and bedrooms of Los Angeles in this dazzling debut novel.

A raucous, drug-fueled party has taken over a boutique hotel on Venice BeachÃ¢â‚¬â€itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a memorial for Lily, the now-deceased, free-spirited proprietress of the place. Little do the attendees know that LilyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s estranged daughterÃ¢â‚¬â€and the nameless narrator of this striking novelÃ¢â‚¬â€is among them, and she has just walked off with a suitcase of LilyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s belongings.

Abandoned by Lily many years ago, she has come a long way to learn about her mother, and the stolen suitcaseÃ¢â‚¬â€stuffed with clothes, letters, and photographsÃ¢â‚¬â€contains not only a history of her motherÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s love life, but perhaps also the key to her own identity. As the tough, resourceful narrator tracks down her motherÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s former husbands, boyfriends, and acquaintances, a risky reenactment of her life begins to unfold. 

Lily had a knack for falling in love with the wrong people, and one man, a fashion photographer turned paparazzo, has begun to work his sinuous charms on the young woman.

Told with high style and noir-ish flare, Anna StothardÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s The Pink Hotel is a powerfully evocative debut novel about wish fulfillment, reckless impulse, and how we discover ourselves.

Genre: General Fiction/Classics
